page.title: 09THE BOWLING GREEN
page.content: The Bowling Green was a gift from Mr Trefusis, it is 70m long by 30m wide and is mostly grass.A committee was formed in 1964 there object was to transform the rough ground for the people of the village. Although there is no record of bowls being played , the name suggests that the game was played here centuries ago.Now on the edge of the Green there is a childrens play area,a public convinience and a tea room. The Bowling Green is unique as it has a 300 degrees view of the surrounding land. During the 1982 Tall Ships Race the best views of the fireworks display at Falmouth docks were seen from the Bowling Green.
